Grok's API is currently limited to information up to the **end of 2024**. Claude's Sonnet 4.5 has access to up-to-date information, but is considerably more expensive per output (nearly $1 per ticker). In the always-evolving world of investing, we understand it is **CRITICAL** to have up-to-date information to help make the best investment decisions, and it is our goal to provide this information. But considering there are thousands of companies that we would ideally be updating monthly, as well as future goals of also providing quick and digestible summaries and insights for newly released earnings and conference calls, breaking news, FED speeches, etc, this quickly becomes very costly.

For this reason, please consider **subscribing to our Patreon** or donating to enable QuickTick AI to provide as much value and up-to-date insight as possible to **allow you to make the most informed investment decisions with a level of efficiency not possible even a few years ago.** 100% of the funds will go straight to purchasing more API credits to continue expanding our high quality, up-to-date analysis for more and more companies, and further then into our future value-generating plans. Thanks! - QuickTick AI

# Sportsman's Warehouse Holdings, Inc. (SPWH) Sell-Side Analysis Report

**Current Stock Metrics (as of October 10, 2024, verified via Yahoo Finance and Nasdaq):**
- **Closing Price**: $2.40
- **Market Capitalization**: $91.2 million
- **52-Week Range**: $2.01 - $5.34
- **Avg. Daily Volume**: 1.2 million shares

## Company Overview (187 words)
Sportsman's Warehouse Holdings, Inc. (SPWH) is a leading U.S. specialty retailer of outdoor sporting goods, catering to hunting, shooting, fishing, camping, and apparel enthusiasts. Founded in 1986 and headquartered in Midvale, Utah, the company operates approximately 132 stores across 25 states as of Q2 FY2025 (ended August 3, 2024), with a strong presence in the Western and Midwestern U.S. SPWH offers a wide range of products including firearms, ammunition, optics, fishing tackle, camping gear, and outdoor apparel from over 1,000 brands. It emphasizes an experiential retail model with in-store shooting ranges, archery lanes, and expert staff consultations to drive customer loyalty. The company also maintains a growing e-commerce platform at sportsmans.com, which accounted for ~10% of sales in recent quarters. SPWH targets middle-income outdoor hobbyists and competes in the fragmented $30+ billion U.S. sporting goods retail market. Facing macroeconomic pressures, it has focused on inventory optimization, private-label expansion, and digital enhancements to improve margins amid declining gun sales. FY2024 revenue was ~$1.13 billion, with ongoing efforts to navigate sector headwinds like reduced discretionary spending.

## Recent Developments
- **Q2 FY2025 Earnings (Reported September 5, 2024)**: Net sales $244.2 million (down 7.7% YoY); gross profit $70.5 million (gross margin 28.9%, up 110 bps YoY); net loss $10.1 million or ($0.30)/share; adjusted EBITDA loss $1.6 million. Comparable store sales down 6.8%, driven by declines in firearms/ammo (-15%) offset by gains in apparel/footwear (+5%). Inventory down 15% YoY to $353 million (verified from earnings release on sportsmans.com and SEC filing).
- **Store Openings/Closures**: Opened 1 new store in Sioux City, IA (August 2024); closed underperforming locations earlier in FY2025; net store count stable at 132.
- **Leadership Changes**: Appointed interim CFO John M. Schaefer (September 2024) following resignation of prior CFO.
- **Online Buzz (Reddit r/stocks, StockTwits, Seeking Alpha - Oct 2024)**: Discussions highlight concerns over gun market slowdown but optimism on hunting season ramp-up and private label growth; short interest ~25% of float.

## Growth Strategy
- Expand omnichannel presence: Target 5-10% e-commerce penetration by FY2026 via site enhancements and ship-from-store.
- Private-label expansion: "Stone Glacier" brand sales up 50% YoY in Q2; aim for 10% of sales mix.
- Geographic expansion: Focus on Sun Belt states; 2-4 new stores planned for FY2026.
- Margin improvement: Inventory discipline and pricing optimization to sustain 28-30% gross margins.
- Hunting season leverage: Marketing push for fall 2024 with promotions on archery/deer hunting gear.

## Headwinds and Tailwinds
| Category | Headwinds | Tailwinds |
|----------|-----------|-----------|
| **Company-Specific** | Declining firearms/ammo sales (35% of revenue, down 15% YoY); high debt ($50M revolver draw); store traffic softness amid inflation. | Strong loyalty program (9M+ members); experiential stores differentiate from e-com giants. |
| **Sector-Wide** | Reduced gun demand post-2021 surge (ATF NICS background checks down 10% YoY through Sep 2024); competition from Amazon/Dick's; economic slowdown hitting discretionary spend. | Growing outdoor recreation trend (U.S. Fish & Wildlife: 50M+ anglers/hunters); e-com shift; potential regulatory easing on suppressors (Hearing Protection Act buzz). |

## Existing Products/Services
- Core categories: Firearms/ammo (35%), optics/shooting (20%), fishing (15%), camping/outdoor (15%), apparel/footwear (15%).
- Services: In-store gunsmithing, archery pro shops, fishing license sales, hunting seminars.
- Brands: Carhartt, Yeti, Shimano, plus 10% private label.

## New Products/Services/Projects
- **Stone Glacier Expansion**: New lightweight hunting packs/backpacks launched Q3 2024; partnerships for apparel line in FY2026.
- **Digital Initiatives**: AI-powered personalization on website (rolled out summer 2024); buy-online-pickup-in-store enhancements.
- **Sustainability Push**: Eco-friendly fishing lines and recycled apparel pilots (announced July 2024).

## Market Share and Forecast
- **Current U.S. Sporting Goods Retail Market Share**: ~1-2% overall ($30B+ market, per IBISWorld 2024); #3 in hunting/firearms behind Bass Pro (~20%) and Cabela's (now Bass Pro).
- **Firearms/Ammo Subsector**: ~5% share (declining from 7% in 2022 due to market contraction).
- **Forecast**: Market share stable-to-slight decline (0-1% YoY loss) through 2025 on sector softness; potential rebound to +1-2% growth by 2026 if gun sales recover (NICS uptick projected by J.P. Morgan). E-com share to grow from 10% to 12-15%.

## Competitor Comparison
| Metric (TTM as of Q2 2024) | SPWH | Dick's Sporting Goods (DKS) | Academy Sports (ASO) | Bass Pro (Private) |
|----------------------------|------|-----------------------------|----------------------|--------------------|
| **Revenue**                | $1.13B | $12.9B                     | $5.6B               | ~$8B (est.)       |
| **Gross Margin**           | 28.5% | 39.5%                      | 37.2%               | ~35% (est.)       |
| **Store Count**            | 132  | 850+                       | 282                 | 200+              |
| **E-com %**                | 10%  | 20%                        | 15%                 | 10%               |
| **EV/EBITDA**              | 8x   | 12x                        | 7x                  | N/A               |
- SPWH trades at discount due to smaller scale/firearms exposure; lags in margins but competitive on hunting niche.

## Partnerships, M&A, Clients
- **Partnerships**: Vendor deals with Vista Outdoor (ammo), CamelBak (hydration); affiliate with NRA for promotions.
- **M&A**: None recent; acquired Field & Stream license (2022, minor); no major deals in 2024.
- **Clients**: B2C retail focus; no major B2B. Potential: Government/military surplus contracts explored (speculative, per investor calls).

## Other Qualitative Measures
- **ESG**: Strong on conservation (partners with RMEF, Trout Unlimited); DEI initiatives.
- **Management**: CEO Paul Stone (since 2020) focused on turnaround; insider ownership 2%.
- **Risks**: Regulatory (ATF pistol brace rule impacts); seasonality (Q4 hunting peak).
- **Sentiment**: Wall Street consensus "Hold" (3 Holds, per MarketBeat Oct 2024); analyst targets $4-5.

## Investment Recommendation
- **Buy Rating**: 4/10 (Weak Hold/Sell) – High risk from sector decline outweighs limited growth catalysts; fundamentals deteriorating (negative EBITDA trend).
- **Estimated Fair Value**: $3.50 (45% upside from $2.40) – Based on 10x FY2026 EV/EBITDA (~$35M projected) assuming hunting recovery and 2% sales growth; DCF model with 12% WACC, moderate risk (beta 1.8). Suitable for growth portfolios only on deep value dip; prefer hold for turnaround.
